For to man renewed and sanctified by grace, the daily aid of God is still necessary for every single act. When there- fore the Apostle wishes grace to the Colossians, he desires sor them the gratuitous favour of God, the habitual gifts of sanctification, and the unceasing actual assistance of God. The union of all these is necessary : inherent grace is not given unless the grace of acceptance has preceded it; neither being given is it available to the production of fruits, unless also the efficacious help of God follow and accompany it through every individual action.
